Lack of credible sources: The expert mentions that the earliest posting of the viral image was on a humor website and a purported press release was also found on the same site. This lack of credible sources raises doubts about the authenticity of the claim.
Inconsistencies in the story: The expert points out that the story of the panda cub traveling in the business class section of a China Airlines airbus is not to be taken seriously. The expert highlights the lack of records for the birth, death, or existence of a panda named Squee Squee, which raises doubts about the truthfulness of the claim.
Contradiction with conservation efforts: The expert mentions that the giant panda is an endangered species and their whereabouts are closely monitored. The claim of a panda cub being transported in the passenger cabin of a commercial airliner contradicts the conservation efforts and strict regulations surrounding the transportation of such animals.
Lack of corroboration from official sour: The expert mentions contacting China Airlines' Public Relations department for clarification. While they acknowledged the existence of the viral image, they did not provide any evidence or confirmation of the claim. The lack of corroboration from official sources adds to the skepticism surrounding the authenticity of the claim.
